metadata.title: CVE-2015-1296 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The UnescapeURLWithAdjustmentsImpl implementation in net/base/escape.cc inGoogle Chrome before 45.0.2454.85 does not prevent display of Unicode LOCKcharacters in the omnibox, which makes it easier for remote attackers tospoof the SSL lock icon by placing one of these characters at the end of aURL, as demonstrated by the omnibox in localizations for right-to-leftlanguages.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1296` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 45.0.2454.85-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1097
chromium-browser-l10n - 45.0.2454.85-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1097
chromium-chromedriver - 45.0.2454.85-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1097
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 45.0.2454.85-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1097
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 45.0.2454.85-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1097
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '45.0.2454.85-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1097').
